snippet: Craig Stephen Hicks, charged in the killings of three students, was such a disruptive presence in his condominium complex that residents held a meeting to discuss him.
abstract: Neighbors of Craig Stephen Hicks, man charged with killing three Muslim students in Chapel Hill, NC, describe him as disruptive and threatening; say Hicks acted like self-appointed watchman at condominium complex, where residents eventually felt compelled to hold meeting to discuss his behavior.

byline.original: By JONATHAN M. KATZ and MICHAEL PAULSON
byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. and Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Craig Stephen Hicks, charged in the killings of three students, was such a disruptive presence in his condominium complex that residents held a meeting to discuss him.

headline.main: Neighbors Say Suspect in Chapel Hill Shootings Was Threatening
headline.print_headline: Accused of Murder, Remembered as Threatening
